# Developer Agent Steps Execution

You are the Developer Agent. You will be assigned a single feature to implement. Your goal is to complete it by following these steps precisely.

## Workflow

1.  **Analyze the Feature**: Read the feature's title, description and rejection (if provided) to understand its goal.
2.  **Consult the File Structure**: Use the provided `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md` to understand the project context.
3.  **Implement**: Write or modify files to meet the feature's acceptance criteria. Use the `write_file`, `rename_file`, `delete_file`, `list_files` and `search_files` tools for all file operations.
4.  **Complete the Feature**: When the feature is complete, you **MUST** call the `finish_feature` tool. This is your final step for a successful implementation.
5.  **Handle Blockers**: If you cannot proceed, you **MUST** use `block_feature` to explain the reason for being stuck - this signals that you are blocked and ready for a new assignment.

## Notes

For context on the overall project structure, including how tasks and features are organized, refer to `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md`. You should always update this file with new major directory changes.
#CURRENT TASK (ID: 18ddab35-6fdd-4316-ae36-e68147787f38)
##TITLE:
It must be possible to rate an agent's run
##DESCRIPTION:
Just a simple thumbs up and down, so that we can analyse this further later.


#ASSIGNED FEATURE: Extend AgentRun data model with rating (ID: 413fc924-f786-44d1-9e55-1158552246e0)
##DESCRIPTION: Modify the `AgentRun` type in `packages/factory-ts/src/types.ts` to include an optional `rating` field. The rating can be 'up', 'down', or null/undefined.






#TOOL SIGNATURES:
- read_files(paths: list[str]) -> list[str] - Read the content of one or more files at the given relative paths. Returns an array of strings (one per file).
- search_files(query: str, path: str = '.') -> list[str] - Search for files by name or textual content under the given path. Returns matching relative paths. The query input must be a space separated list of keywords
- block_feature(reason: str) - Stop work on the current feature and report why you are blocked (e.g., missing context, unclear requirements).
- finish_feature() - Mark the current feature as complete and end the run. Use only when the work fully meets the acceptance criteria.
- list_files(path: str) - List files and directories at a relative path from the project root.
- write_file(filename: str, content: str) - Create or overwrite a file with the given content. Always use this to write code or docs.
- rename_file(filename: str, new_filename: str) - Rename or move a file from one path to another.
- delete_file(filename: str) - Delete a file. Use with caution and only when necessary.
- run_test() -> str - Run the test for the current feature and return the output. Use to verify implementation.

#RESPONSE FORMAT INSTRUCTIONS:
You **MUST** respond in a single, valid JSON object. This object must adhere to the following structure:
```json
[object Object]
```
The thoughts field is for your reasoning, and tool_calls is a list of actions to execute.
Your response will be parsed as JSON. Do not include any text outside of this JSON object.
As responses to the tool calls you will send, you will also receive JSON objects in the form:
```json
{
"name":"tool_name",
"result":"..."
}
```

#CONTEXT FILES PROVIDED:
{"docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md":"# File Organisation\n\nPurpose\n- Provide a high-level map of the repository so contributors and agents can quickly find the right area.\n- This is not a change log and not a per-file inventory.\n\nEditing Rules (read before updating)\n- Only document major directories and subsystems. Do not list individual files.\n- Keep bullets short (one sentence) and avoid \"New:\" or historical notes.\n- When adding/removing a major directory or moving a subsystem, update a single bullet here.\n- Prefer linking or pointing to deeper docs (README/OVERVIEW) rather than describing internals here.\n- Never document build related artifacts.\n\nTop-Level Layout\n- docs/: Project-wide documentation and specs; single source of truth for protocols and workflows.\n- src/: Application source (Electron app: main, preload, renderer, and tooling).\n  - live-data/: Main process live data service and types for live data services.\n    - providers/: Pluggable provider implementations (e.g., agent-prices bridge, generic fetch-json).\n    - registry.js: Provider registry to map service ids to providers.\n    - store.js: Persistence for service configs and cached snapshots by service id.\n    - types.js: Shared types and helpers (freshness policy, normalization, freshness computation).\n  - renderer/: React UI (components, screens, hooks, services, navigation, preview runtime).\n    - components/agents/: Agent-specific UI (status chips, run bullets, model selectors, project/cost/token chips).\n    - services/: Renderer-side services (e.g., pricingService for LLM price lookup via IPC).\n    - hooks/useShortcuts: Keyboard shortcuts provider; respects user-selected modifier and avoids interfering with text input.\n  - tools/: Developer and agent tooling (preview analyzer, factory integration, helpers).\n  - main.js: Electron main process entry.\n  - preload.js: Safe IPC surface exposed to the renderer (exposes live data API).\n- packages/: Local monorepo packages.\n  - factory-ts/: Agent orchestration library (orchestrator, pricing, history, completion, git integration).\n- scripts/: Project automation scripts and CLIs.\n- Root config files: package.json, tsconfig.json, tailwind/postcss configs, vite configs, forge config, .env.\n\nWhere to Learn More\n- Agents and roles: packages/factory-ts/docs (AGENT_*.md).\n- Factory TS overview and APIs: packages/factory-ts (see README/OVERVIEW files in that package).\n- Preview system: see src/renderer/preview and related docs in docs/ (preview usage and analyzer).\n- IPC and factory integration: src/tools/factory (renderer bridge and main process handlers).\n\nConventions (brief)\n- Keep cross-cutting documentation in docs/; place domain-specific or area-specific READMEs next to the code they describe.\n- Use descriptive directory names and keep responsibilities separated by area (renderer vs main vs tools vs packages).\n\nEnvironment & Credentials\n- .env at the repo root is used for local development (e.g., credentials consumed by tooling and factory-ts).\n\nNotes\n- If you are unsure whether something belongs here, it probably belongs in a local README under its directory, with this file providing only a one-line pointer to that area.\n"}

Begin now.

[{"name":"read_files","result":"{\"packages/factory-ts/src/types.ts\":\"export type Status = '+' | '-' | '~' | '?' | '=';\\nexport interface Feature {\\n  id: string;\\n  status: Status;\\n  title: string;\\n  description: string;\\n  context: string[];\\n  plan?: string;\\n  acceptance?: string[];\\n  blockers?: string[];\\n  rejection?: string;\\n}\\nexport interface Task {\\n  id: string;\\n  title: string;\\n  description: string;\\n  status: Status;\\n  features: Feature[];\\n  featureIdToDisplayIndex: Record<string, number>;\\n  blockers?: string[];\\n  rejection?: string;\\n}\\nexport interface ProjectRequirement {\\n  id: number;\\n  status: Status;\\n  description: string;\\n  tasks: string[];\\n}\\nexport interface ProjectSpec {\\n  id: string;\\n  title: string;\\n  description: string;\\n  path: string;\\n  repo_url: string;\\n  requirements: ProjectRequirement[];\\n  taskIdToDisplayIndex: Record<string, number>;\\n  metadata?: Record<string,any>;\\n}\\nexport type CompletionMessageRole = 'system' | 'user' | 'assistant';\\nexport type CompletionMessage = { role: CompletionMessageRole; content: string };\\nexport type CompletionUsage = {\\n  promptTokens?: number;\\n  completionTokens?: number;\\\\n  totalTokens?: number;\\\\n  costUSD?: number;\\\\n  provider?: string;\\\\n  model?: string;\\\\n};\\nexport type CompletionResponse = { message: { role: 'assistant'; content: string }; usage?: CompletionUsage };\\nexport type CompletionClient = (req: { model: string; messages: CompletionMessage[]; response_format?: any }) => Promise<CompletionResponse>;\\nexport type ToolCall = { tool_name?: string; tool?: string; name?: string; arguments?: any; parameters?: any };\\nexport type ToolResult = { name: string; result: string };\\nexport type AgentResponse = { thoughts?: string; tool_calls?: ToolCall[] };\\n\\nexport type LLMConfig = {\\n  model: string;\\n  provider: string; // e.g., openai, azure, together, groq, openrouter, ollama, custom\\n  apiKey: string;\\n  apiBaseUrl: string;\\n\\n  // extra provider fields (azure etc.) tolerated\\n  [key: string]: any;\\n};\\n\\n\\nexport type AgentType = 'developer' | 'tester' | 'planner' | 'contexter' | 'speccer';\\nexport type AgentRun = {\\n  agent: AgentType;\\n  projectId: string;\\n  taskId: string;\\n  featureId?: string;\\n  llmConfig: LLMConfig;\\n  options?: {\\n    budgetUSD?: number;\\\\n    metadata?: Record<string, any>;\\\\n  }\\\\n};\\nexport type RunEvent = { type: string; payload?: any };\\n\\n// Live Data Service Types\\nexport type LiveDataServiceFreshnessPolicy = 'daily' | 'weekly' | 'monthly';\\nexport type LiveDataServiceAutoUpdateTrigger = 'onAppLaunch' | 'scheduled';\\n\\nexport interface LiveDataServiceAutoUpdateSettings {\\n  enabled: boolean;\\n  trigger: LiveDataServiceAutoUpdateTrigger;\\n}\\n\\nexport interface LiveDataService<TConfig = unknown> {\\n  id: string;\\n  name: string;\\n  description: string;\\n  lastUpdated: number; // Unix timestamp\\n  freshnessPolicy: LiveDataServiceFreshnessPolicy;\\n  autoUpdate: LiveDataServiceAutoUpdateSettings;\\n  config: TConfig; // Service-specific configuration\\n}\\n\"}"}]

{"thoughts":"Reading pricing.ts to confirm file formatting style and avoid introducing formatting issues before updating types.ts.","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"read_files","arguments":{"paths":["packages/factory-ts/src/pricing.ts"]}}]}

[{"name":"read_files","result":"{\"packages/factory-ts/src/pricing.ts\":\"import fs from 'node:fs';\\nimport path from 'node:path';\\nimport fetch from 'node-fetch';\\n\\nexport type ModelPrice = {\\n  provider: string; // e.g., openai\\n  model: string;    // e.g., gpt-4o-mini\\n  inputPerMTokensUSD: number;    // cost per 1,000,000 input tokens in USD\\n  outputPerMTokensUSD: number;   // cost per 1,000,000 output tokens in USD\\n  currency?: 'USD';\\n};\\n\\nexport type PricingState = {\\n  updatedAt: string;\\n  prices: ModelPrice[];\\n};\\n\\nexport type PricingConfig = {\\n  // Optional mapping to JSON endpoints you can refresh from per provider\\n  supplierUrls?: Record<string, string>;\\n};\\n\\n// Canonical source for LLM prices from a trusted community project\\nconst CANONICAL_PRICES_URL = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/e2b-dev/llm-cost/main/static/models.json';\\n\\nfunction ensureDir(p: string) {\\n  try { fs.mkdirSync(p, { recursive: true }); } catch {}\\n}\\n\\nfunction nowIso() { return new Date().toISOString(); }\\n\\nexport class PricingManager {\\n  private readonly root: string;\\n  private readonly storeFile: string;\\n  private readonly configFile: string;\\n  private state: PricingState;\\n  private readonly defaults: PricingState;\\n\\n  constructor(projectRoot?: string, defaults?: PricingState) {\\n    this.root = path.resolve(projectRoot || process.cwd());\\n    const confDir = path.join(this.root, '.factory');\\n    ensureDir(confDir);\\n    this.storeFile = path.join(confDir, 'prices.json');\\n    this.configFile = path.join(confDir, 'pricing.config.json');\\n    this.defaults = defaults || { updatedAt: nowIso(), prices: loadBuiltInDefaults() };\\n    this.state = this.loadFromDisk() || this.defaults;\\n  }\\n\\n  private loadFromDisk(): PricingState | null {\\n    try {\\n      const raw = fs.readFileSync(this.storeFile, 'utf8');\\n      const parsed = JSON.parse(raw);\\n      if (parsed && Array.isArray(parsed.prices)) return parsed as PricingState;\\n    } catch {}\\n    return null;\\n  }\\n\\n  private saveToDisk() {\\n    try {\\n      ensureDir(path.dirname(this.storeFile));\\n      fs.writeFileSync(this.storeFile, JSON.stringify(this.state, null, 2), 'utf8');\\n    } catch {}\\n  }\\n\\n  listPrices(): PricingState {\\n    return this.state;\\n  }\\n\\n  upsertPrices(prices: ModelPrice[], updatedAt?: string) {\\n    const map = new Map<string, ModelPrice>();\\n    for (const p of this.state.prices) map.set(`${p.provider}:${p.model}`, p);\\n    for (const p of prices) map.set(`${p.provider}:${p.model}`, p);\\n    this.state = { updatedAt: updatedAt || nowIso(), prices: Array.from(map.values()) };\\n    this.saveToDisk();\\n  }\\n\\n  getPrice(provider: string | undefined, model: string | undefined): ModelPrice | undefined {\\n    if (!provider || !model) return undefined;\\n    const key = `${provider}:${model}`.toLowerCase();\\n    return this.state.prices.find(p => `${p.provider}:${p.model}`.toLowerCase() === key);\\n  }\\n\\n  private async fetchAndParsePrices(url: string): Promise<ModelPrice[]> {\\n    const newPrices: ModelPrice[] = [];\\n    try {\\n      const res = await fetch(url);\\n      if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`HTTP ${res.status}`);\\n      const data = await res.json();\\n      \\n      // Handle canonical source format (object of objects)\\n      if (url === CANONICAL_PRICES_URL && typeof data === 'object' && data !== null && !Array.isArray(data)) {\\n        for (const modelKey in data) {\\n            const raw = data[modelKey];\\n            if (raw && raw.litellm_provider && raw.model_name && raw.input_cost_per_mtok !== undefined && raw.output_cost_per_mtok !== undefined) {\\n                const input = Number(raw.input_cost_per_mtok);\\n                const output = Number(raw.output_cost_per_mtok);\\n                if (!isFinite(input) || !isFinite(output)) continue;\\n                newPrices.push({ provider: String(raw.litellm_provider), model: String(raw.model_name), inputPerMTokensUSD: input, outputPerMTokensUSD: output, currency: 'USD' });\\n            }\\n        }\\n      } else {\\n        // Handle user-configured format (array of ModelPrice or { prices: ModelPrice[] })\\n        const arr = Array.isArray(data) ? data : (Array.isArray(data?.prices) ? data.prices : []);\\n        for (const raw of arr) {\\n          if (raw && raw.provider && raw.model) {\\n            const input = Number(raw.inputPerMTokensUSD ?? raw.input_per_m_tokens_usd ?? (raw.inputPerKTokensUSD ? raw.inputPerKTokensUSD * 1000 : undefined));\\n            const output = Number(raw.outputPerMTokensUSD ?? raw.output_per_m_tokens_usd ?? (raw.outputPerKTokensUSD ? raw.outputPerKTokensUSD * 1000 : undefined));\\n            if (!isFinite(input) || !isFinite(output)) continue;\\n            newPrices.push({ provider: String(raw.provider), model: String(raw.model), inputPerMTokensUSD: input, outputPerMTokensUSD: output, currency: 'USD' });\\n          }\\n        }\\n      }\\n    } catch (e) {\\n      console.error(`Failed to fetch prices from ${url}:`, e);\\n      // Ignore source errors; keep previous values\\n    }\\n    return newPrices;\\n  }\\n\\n  async refresh(provider?: string, urlOverride?: string): Promise<PricingState> {\\n    const cfg = this.loadConfig();\\n    const allNewPrices: ModelPrice[] = [];\\n\\n    if (provider) {\\n        // Refresh a specific provider\\n        const url = urlOverride || cfg.supplierUrls?.[provider];\\n        if (url) {\\n            const prices = await this.fetchAndParsePrices(url);\\n            allNewPrices.push(...prices);\\n        }\\n    } else if (urlOverride) {\\n        // Refresh from a specific URL without being tied to a provider config\\n        const prices = await this.fetchAndParsePrices(urlOverride);\\n        allNewPrices.push(...prices);\\n    }\\n    else {\\n        // Full refresh: canonical + all user-configured\\n        // 1. Fetch from canonical source\\n        const canonicalPrices = await this.fetchAndParsePrices(CANONICAL_PRICES_URL);\\n        allNewPrices.push(...canonicalPrices);\\n        \\n        // 2. Fetch from user-configured sources\\n        const supplierUrls = cfg.supplierUrls || {};\\n        for (const prov in supplierUrls) {\\n            const url = supplierUrls[prov];\\n            if (url) {\\n                const userPrices = await this.fetchAndParsePrices(url);\\n                allNewPrices.push(...userPrices);\\n            }\\n        }\\n    }\\n\\n    if (allNewPrices.length) {\\n      this.upsertPrices(allNewPrices);\\n    }\\n    \\n    return this.state;\\n  }\\n\\n  loadConfig(): PricingConfig {\\n    try {\\n      const raw = fs.readFileSync(this.configFile, 'utf8');\\n      const parsed = JSON.parse(raw);\\n      return parsed || {};\\n    } catch {}\\n    return { supplierUrls: {} };\\n  }\\n\\n  saveConfig(cfg: PricingConfig) {\\n    ensureDir(path.dirname(this.configFile));\\n    fs.writeFileSync(this.configFile, JSON.stringify(cfg, null, 2), 'utf8');\\n  }\\n}\\n\\nfunction loadBuiltInDefaults(): ModelPrice[] {\\n  try {\\n    const p = path.join(process.cwd(), 'packages', 'factory-ts', 'assets', 'default-prices.json');\\n    const raw = fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8');\\n    const data = JSON.parse(raw) as { prices: ModelPrice[] };\\n    const arr: ModelPrice[] = Array.isArray(data) ? data : (Array.isArray(data?.prices) ? data.prices : []);\\n    return arr\\n  } catch {\\n    // Minimal safe defaults if asset missing\\n    return [\\n      { provider: 'openai', model: 'gpt-4o-mini', inputPerMTokensUSD: 0.15, outputPerMTokensUSD: 0.60, currency: 'USD' },\\n      { provider: 'openai', model: 'gpt-4o', inputPerMTokensUSD: 5.0, outputPerMTokensUSD: 15.0, currency: 'USD' },\\n      { provider: 'openai', model: 'gpt-3.5-turbo', inputPerMTokensUSD: 0.5, outputPerMTokensUSD: 1.5, currency: 'USD' },\\n    ];\\n  }\\n}\\n\\nexport function createPricingManager(opts?: { projectRoot?: string; defaults?: PricingState }) {\\n  return new PricingManager(opts?.projectRoot, opts?.defaults);\\n}\\n\\nexport function estimateCostUSD(tokensIn: number, tokensOut: number, price?: ModelPrice): number | undefined {\\n  if (!price) return undefined;\\n  const inCost = (tokensIn / 1_000_000) * price.inputPerMTokensUSD;\\n  const outCost = (tokensOut / 1_000_000) * price.outputPerMTokensUSD;\\n  const total = inCost + outCost;\\n  return isFinite(total) ? Number(total.toFixed(8)) : undefined;\\n}\\n\"}"}]

## Workflow

2.  **Consult the File Structure**: Use the provided `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md` to understand the project context.
3.  **Implement**: Write or modify files to meet the feature's acceptance criteria. Use the `write_file`, `rename_file`, `delete_file`, `list_files` and `search_files` tools for all file operations.
4.  **Complete the Feature**: When the feature is complete, you **MUST** call the `finish_feature` tool. This is your final step for a successful implementation.
5.  **Handle Blockers**: If you cannot proceed, you **MUST** use `block_feature` to explain the reason for being stuck - this signals that you are blocked and ready for a new assignment.

# Developer Agent Steps Execution

You are the Developer Agent. You will be assigned a single feature to implement. Your goal is to complete it by following these steps precisely.

## Workflow

1.  **Analyze the Feature**: Read the feature's title, description and rejection (if provided) to understand its goal.
2.  **Consult the File Structure**: Use the provided `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md` to understand the project context.
3.  **Implement**: Write or modify files to meet the feature's acceptance criteria. Use the `write_file`, `rename_file`, `delete_file`, `list_files` and `search_files` tools for all file operations.
4.  **Complete the Feature**: When the feature is complete, you **MUST** call the `finish_feature` tool. This is your final step for a successful implementation.
5.  **Handle Blockers**: If you cannot proceed, you **MUST** use `block_feature` to explain the reason for being stuck - this signals that you are blocked and ready for a new assignment.

## Notes

For context on the overall project structure, including how tasks and features are organized, refer to `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md`. You should always update this file with new major directory changes.

#TOOL SIGNATURES:
- read_files(paths: list[str]) -> list[str] - Read the content of one or more files at the given relative paths. Returns an array of strings (one per file).
- search_files(query: str, path: str = '.') -> list[str] - Search for files by name or textual content under the given path. Returns matching relative paths. The query input must be a space separated list of keywords
- block_feature(reason: str) - Stop work on the current feature and report why you are blocked (e.g., missing context, unclear requirements).
- finish_feature() - Mark the current feature as complete and end the run. Use only when the work fully meets the acceptance criteria.
- list_files(path: str) - List files and directories at a relative path from the project root.
- write_file(filename: str, content: str) - Create or overwrite a file with the given content. Always use this to write code or docs.
- rename_file(filename: str, new_filename: str) - Rename or move a file from one path to another.
- delete_file(filename: str) - Delete a file. Use with caution and only when necessary.
- run_test() -> str - Run the test for the current feature and return the output. Use to verify implementation.

'***' : '' };\\n}\\n\\nconst NOOP_EVENTS: EventSourceLike = { addEventListener: (_t: string, _h: (e: any) => void) => {}, close: () => {} };\\nconst DEFAULT_FEATURE_KEY = '__task__';\\n\\nclass AgentsServiceImpl {\\n  private runs = new Map<string, RunRecord>();\\n  private subscribers = new Set<Subscriber>();\\n  private bootstrapped = false;\\n\\n  private notify() {\\n    const list = Array.from(this.runs.values()).map(this.publicFromRecord);\\n    for (const cb of this.subscribers) cb(list);\\n  }\\n\\n  private publicFromRecord(rec: RunRecord): AgentRun {\\n    const { events: _ev, cancel: _c, __notifiedFeatures: _nf, ...pub } = rec as any;\\n    return pub as AgentRun;\\n  }\\n\\n  private async bootstrapFromActiveRuns() {\\n    if (this.bootstrapped) return;\\n    this.bootstrapped = true;\\n    try {\\n      const factory = (window as any).factory;\\n      if (!factory) return;\\n      // 1) Attach to active\\n      if (typeof factory.listActiveRuns === 'function') {\\n        const active = await factory.listActiveRuns();\\n        if (Array.isArray(active)) {\\n          for (const m of active) {\\n            if (!m?.runId) continue;\\n            if (this.runs.has(m.runId)) continue;\\n            const { handle, events } = attachToRun(m.runId);\\n            const run: RunRecord = {\\n              runId: handle.id,\\n              agentType: m.agentType,\\n              projectId: m.projectId,\\n              taskId: m.taskId,\\n              featureId: m.featureId ?? undefined,\\n              state: m.state ?? '',\\n            progress: m.progress,\\n            costUSD: m.costUSD,\\n            promptTokens: m.promptTokens,\\n            completionTokens: m.completionTokens,\\n            provider: m.provider,\\n            model: m.model,\\n            startedAt: m.startedAt || new Date().toISOString(),\\n            updatedAt: m.updatedAt || new Date().toISOString(),\\n            lastMessageAt: undefined,\\n            messagesLog: {},\\n            events: NOOP_EVENTS,\\n            cancel: () => {},\\n            __notifiedFeatures: new Set<string>(),\\n          } as RunRecord;\\n          this.runs.set(rec.runId, rec);\\n          \\n          try {\\n            rec.messagesLog  = await factory.getRunMessages(rec.runId);\\n          } catch (err) {\\n            console.warn('[agentsService] Failed to load messages for history run', rec.runId, (err as any)?.message || err);\\n          }\\n        }\\n      }\\n      this.notify();\\n    } catch (err) {\\n      console.warn('[agentsService] bootstrapFromActiveRuns failed', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n    }\\n  }\\n\\n  subscribe(cb: Subscriber): () => void {\\n    this.subscribers.add(cb);\\n    // Lazy bootstrap when first subscriber attaches\\n    this.bootstrapFromActiveRuns();\\n    cb(Array.from(this.runs.values()).map(this.publicFromRecord));\\n    return () => {\\n      this.subscribers.delete(cb);\\n    };\\n  }\\n\\n  list(): AgentRun[] {\\n    // Also attempt a bootstrap if not yet done (defensive)\\n    this.bootstrapFromActiveRuns();\\n    return Array.from(this.runs.values()).map(this.publicFromRecord);\\n  }\\n\\n  cancelRun(runId: string) {\\n    const rec = this.runs.get(runId);\\n    console.log('[agentsService] cancelRun', { runId, known: !!rec });\\n    if (!rec) return;\\n    try { rec.cancel('User requested'); } catch (err) { console.warn('[agentsService] cancel error', (err as any)?.message || err); }\\n    rec.state = 'cancelled';\\n    rec.updatedAt = new Date().toISOString();\\n    this.notify();\\n  }\\n\\n  async removeRun(runId: string) {\\n    const rec = this.runs.get(runId);\\n    if (!rec) return;\\n    if (rec.state === 'running') {\\n      console.warn('[agentsService] removeRun ignored for running run', runId);\\n      return;\\n    }\\n    // Optimistic update\\n    this.runs.delete(runId);\\n    this.notify();\\n    try {\\n      await deleteHistoryRun(runId);\\n    } catch (err) {\\n      console.warn('[agentsService] Failed to delete run from history store', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n    }\\n  }\\n\\n  private logEventVerbose(run: RunRecord, e: any) {\\n    try {\\n      const type = e?.type || 'unknown';\\n      const payload = e?.payload;\\n      if (String(type).startsWith('llm/')) {\\n        console.log('[agentsService] LLM event', run.runId, type, payload ? ''), createdAt, askedAt });\\n    }\\n    existing.messages = newMessages\\n  }\\n\\n  private deriveFeatureKey(e?: any): string {\\n    return `${e?.payload?.featureId || DEFAULT_FEATURE_KEY}`\\n  }\\n\\n  private async fireCompletionNotifications(run: RunRecord) {\\n    try {\\n      const baseTitle = 'Agent finished';\\n      const parts: string[] = [];\\n      parts.push(`Agent ${run.agentType}`);\\n      parts.push(`task ${run.taskId}`);\\n      const message = parts.join(' • ');\\n\\n      await notificationsService.create(run.projectId, {\\n        type: 'success',\\n        category: 'tasks',\\n        title: baseTitle,\\n        message,\\n        metadata: { taskId: run.taskId },\\n      } as any);\\n\\n    } catch (err) {\\n      console.warn('[agentsService] Failed to create completion notifications', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n    }\\n  }\\n\\n  // Detect a feature completion by inspecting normalized messages log for a finish_feature tool call\\n  private featureHasFinishTool(messages: any[]): boolean {\\n    try {\\n      for (const m of messages) {\\n        if (!m) continue;\\n        const role = (m as any).role;\\n        const content = String((m as any).content ?? '');\\n        if (role === 'assistant') {\\n          // Quick check\\n          if (content.includes('finish_feature')) return true;\\n          try {\\n            const parsed = JSON.parse(content);\\n            const calls = (parsed?.tool_calls || parsed?.tool_calls || []);\\n            if (Array.isArray(calls)) {\\n              for (const c of calls) {\\n                const name = c?.tool_name || c?.tool || c?.name;\\n                if (name === 'finish_feature') return true;\\n              }\\n            }\\n          } catch {\\n            // ignore JSON parse errors; substring check already attempted\\n          }\\n        }\\n      }\\n    } catch {}\\n    return false;\\n  }\\n\\n  private async checkAndNotifyFeatureCompletions(run: RunRecord) {\\n    try {\\n      const factory = (window as any).factory;\\n      if (!factory?.getRunMessages) return;\\n      const normalized: Record<string, { featureId: string; messages: any[] }> = await factory.getRunMessages(run.runId);\\n      if (!normalized || typeof normalized !== 'object') return;\\n      if (!run.__notifiedFeatures) run.__notifiedFeatures = new Set<string>();\\n      for (const key of Object.keys(normalized)) {\\n        const group = (normalized as any)[key];\\n        const fid = String(group?.featureId || key);\\n        if (fid === DEFAULT_FEATURE_KEY) continue; // skip task-level chat\\n        if (run.__notifiedFeatures.has(fid)) continue;\\n        const msgs = Array.isArray(group?.messages) ? group.messages : [];\\n        if (msgs.length === 0) continue;\\n        const finished = this.featureHasFinishTool(msgs);\\n        if (finished) {\\n          try {\\n            await notificationsService.create(run.projectId, {\\n              type: 'success',\\n              category: 'tasks',\\n              title: 'Feature completed',\\n              message: `Task ${run.taskId} • Feature ${fid} committed`,\\n              metadata: { taskId: run.taskId, featureId: fid },\\n            } as any);\\n          } catch (err) {\\n            console.warn('[agentsService] Failed to create feature completion notification', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n          }\\n          run.__notifiedFeatures.add(fid);\\n        }\\n      }\\n    } catch (err) {\\n      console.warn('[agentsService] checkAndNotifyFeatureCompletions failed', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n    }\\n  }\\n\\n  private wireRunEvents(run: RunRecord) {\\n    const onAny = (e: any) => {\\n      this.logEventVerbose(run, e);\\n      const ts = getEventTs(e);\\n      run.updatedAt = ts;\\n      const featureKey = this.deriveFeatureKey(e);\\n\\n      // Conversation handling\\n      if (e.type === 'llm/messages/init') {\\n        const msgs = e.payload?.messages ?? [];\\n        this.replaceMessages(run, msgs, featureKey, false, ts);\\n      } else if (e.type === 'llm/messages/snapshot') {\\n        const msgs = e.payload?.messages ?? [];\\n        this.replaceMessages(run, msgs, featureKey, false, ts);\\n      } else if (e.type === 'llm/message') {\\n        const msg = e.payload?.message;\\n        if (msg) this.appendMessage(run, msg, featureKey, ts);\\n        // Update last message time strictly on actual message events\\n        run.lastMessageAt = ts;\\n      } else if (e.type === 'llm/messages/final') {\\n        const msgs = e.payload?.messages ?? [];\\n        this.replaceMessages(run, msgs, featureKey, true, ts);\\n        // Finalize last message time at end of conversation\\n        run.lastMessageAt = ts;\\n        // On final messages (end of a feature conversation), re-scan normalized messages and emit feature-complete notifications\\n        this.checkAndNotifyFeatureCompletions(run);\\n      }\\n\\n      // Meta updates\\n      if (e.type === 'run/progress' || e.type === 'run/progress/snapshot') {\\n        run.message = e.payload?.message ?? run.message;\\n        if (typeof e.payload?.progress === 'number') {\\n          run.progress = e.payload.progress;\\n        } else if (typeof e.payload?.percent === 'number') {\\n          run.progress = Math.max(0, Math.min(1, e.payload.percent / 100));\\n        }\\n      } else if (e.type === 'run/usage') {\\n        run.costUSD = getCostUSD(e.payload) ?? run.costUSD;\\n        run.promptTokens = e.payload?.promptTokens ?? run.promptTokens;\\n        run.completionTokens = e.payload?.completionTokens ?? run.completionTokens;\\n        run.provider = e.payload?.provider ?? run.provider;\\n        run.model = e.payload?.model ?? run.model;\\n      } else if (e.type === 'run/start') {\\n        // initialize from start payload if present\\n        run.provider = e.payload?.llm?.provider ?? # Developer Agent Steps Execution

You are the Developer Agent. You will be assigned a single feature to implement. Your goal is to complete it by following these steps precisely.

## Workflow

1.  **Analyze the Feature**: Read the feature's title, description and rejection (if provided) to understand its goal.
2.  **Consult the File Structure**: Use the provided `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md` to understand the project context.
3.  **Implement**: Write or modify files to meet the feature's acceptance criteria. Use the `write_file`, `rename_file`, `delete_file`, `list_files` and `search_files` tools for all file operations.
4.  **Complete the Feature**: When the feature is complete, you **MUST** call the `finish_feature` tool. This is your final step for a successful implementation.
5.  **Handle Blockers**: If you cannot proceed, you **MUST** use `block_feature` to explain the reason for being stuck - this signals that you are blocked and ready for a new assignment.

## Notes

For context on the overall project structure, including how tasks and features are organized, refer to `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md`. You should always update this file with new major directory changes.

#TOOL SIGNATURES:
- read_files(paths: list[str]) -> list[str] - Read the content of one or more files at the given relative paths. Returns an array of strings (one per file).
- search_files(query: str, path: str = '.') -> list[str] - Search for files by name or textual content under the given path. Returns matching relative paths. The query input must be a space separated list of keywords
- block_feature(reason: str) - Stop work on the current feature and report why you are blocked (e.g., missing context, unclear requirements).
- finish_feature() - Mark the current feature as complete and end the run. Use only when the work fully meets the acceptance criteria.
- list_files(path: str) - List files and directories at a relative path from the project root.
- write_file(filename: str, content: str) - Create or overwrite a file with the given content. Always use this to write code or docs.
- rename_file(filename: str, new_filename: str) - Rename or move a file from one path to another.
- delete_file(filename: str) - Delete a file. Use with caution and only when necessary.
- run_test() -> str - Run the test for the current feature and return the output. Use to verify implementation.

#RESPONSE FORMAT INSTRUCTIONS:
You **MUST** respond in a single, valid JSON object. This object must adhere to the following structure:
```json
[object Object]
```
The thoughts field is for your reasoning, and tool_calls is a list of actions to execute.
Your response will be parsed as JSON. Do not include any text outside of this JSON object.
As responses to the tool calls you will send, you will also receive JSON objects in the form:
```json
{
"name":"tool_name",
"result":"..."
}
```

# Developer Agent Steps Execution

You are the Developer Agent. You will be assigned a single feature to implement. Your goal is to complete it by following these steps precisely.

## Workflow

1.  **Analyze the Feature**: Read the feature's title, description and rejection (if provided) to understand its goal.
2.  **Consult the File Structure**: Use the provided `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md` to understand the project context.
3.  **Implement**: Write or modify files to meet the feature's acceptance criteria. Use the `write_file`, `rename_file`, `delete_file`, `list_files` and `search_files` tools for all file operations.
4.  **Complete the Feature**: When the feature is complete, you **MUST** call the `finish_feature` tool. This is your final step for a successful implementation.
5.  **Handle Blockers**: If you cannot proceed, you **MUST** use `block_feature` to explain the reason for being stuck - this signals that you are blocked and ready for a new assignment.

## Notes

For context on the overall project structure, including how tasks and features are organized, refer to `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md`. You should always update this file with new major directory changes.

- read_files(paths: list[str]) -> list[str] - Read the content of one or more files at the given relative paths. Returns an array of strings (one per file).
- search_files(query: str, path: str = '.') -> list[str] - Search for files by name or textual content under the given path. Returns matching relative paths. The query input must be a space separated list of keywords
- block_feature(reason: str) - Stop work on the current feature and report why you are blocked (e.g., missing context, unclear requirements).
- finish_feature() - Mark the current feature as complete and end the run. Use only when the work fully meets the acceptance criteria.
- list_files(path: str) - List files and directories at a relative path from the project root.
- write_file(filename: str, content: str) - Create or overwrite a file with the given content. Always use this to write code or docs.
- rename_file(filename: str, new_filename: str) - Rename or move a file from one path to another.
- delete_file(filename: str) - Delete a file. Use with caution and only when necessary.
- run_test() -> str - Run the test for the current feature and return the output. Use to verify implementation.

''), createdAt, askedAt });\\n }\\n existing.messages = newMessages\\n }\\n\\n private deriveFeatureKey(e?: any): string {\\n return `${e?.payload?.featureId || DEFAULT_FEATURE_KEY}`\\n }\\n\\n private async fireCompletionNotifications(run: RunRecord) {\\n try {\\n const baseTitle = 'Agent finished';\\n const parts: string[] = [];\\n parts.push(`Agent ${run.agentType}`);\\n parts.push(`task ${run.taskId}`);\\n const message = parts.join(' • ');\\n\\n await notificationsService.create(run.projectId, {\\n type: 'success',\\n category: 'tasks',\\n title: baseTitle,\\n message,\\n metadata: { taskId: run.taskId },\\n } as any);\\n\\n } catch (err) {\\n console.warn('[agentsService] Failed to create completion notifications', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n }\\n }\\n\\n // Detect a feature completion by inspecting normalized messages log for a finish_feature tool call\\n private featureHasFinishTool(messages: any[]): boolean {\\n try {\\n for (const m of messages) {\\n if (!m) continue;\\n const role = (m as any).role;\\n const content = String((m as any).content ?? group.messages : [];\\n if (msgs.length === 0) continue;\\n const finished = this.featureHasFinishTool(msgs);\\n if (finished) {\\n try {\\n await notificationsService.create(run.projectId, {\\n type: 'success',\\n category: 'tasks',\\n title: 'Feature completed',\\n message: `Task ${run.taskId} • Feature ${fid} committed`,\\n metadata: { taskId: run.taskId, featureId: fid },\\n } as any);\\n } catch (err) {\\n console.warn('[agentsService] Failed to create feature completion notification', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n }\\n run.__notifiedFeatures.add(fid);\\n }\\n }\\n } catch (err) {\\n console.warn('[agentsService] checkAndNotifyFeatureCompletions failed', (err as any)?.message || err);\\n }\\n }\\n\\n private wireRunEvents(run: RunRecord) {\\n const onAny = (e: any) => {\\n this.logEventVerbose(run, e);\\n const ts = getEventTs(e);\\n run.updatedAt = ts;\\n const featureKey = this.deriveFeatureKey(e);\\n\\n // Conversation handling\\n if (e.type === 'llm/messages/init') {\\n const msgs = e.payload?.messages ?? [];\\n this.replaceMessages(run, msgs, featureKey, true, ts);\\n // Finalize last message time at end of conversation\\n run.lastMessageAt = ts;\\n // On final messages (end of a feature conversation), re-scan normalized messages and emit feature-complete notifications\\n this.checkAndNotifyFeatureCompletions(run);\\n }\\n\\n // Meta updates\\n if (e.type === 'run/progress' || e.type === 'run/progress/snapshot') {\\n run.message = e.payload?.message ?? run.message;\\n if (typeof e.payload?.progress === 'number') {\\n run.progress = e.payload.progress;\\n } else if (typeof e.payload?.percent === 'number') {\\n run.progress = Math.max(0, Math.min(1, e.payload.percent / 100));\\n }\\n } else if (e.type === 'run/usage') {\\n run.costUSD = getCostUSD(e.payload) ?? run.costUSD;\\n run.promptTokens = e.payload?.promptTokens ?? run.promptTokens;\\n run.completionTokens = e.payload?.completionTokens ?? run.completionTokens;\\n run.provider = e.payload?.provider ?? run.provider;\\n run.model = e.payload?.model ?? run.model;\\n } else if (e.type === 'run/start') {\\n // initialize from start payload if present\\n run.provider = e.payload?.llm?.provider ?? run.provider;\\n run.model = e.payload?.llm?.model ?? run.model;\\n } else if (e.type === 'run/snapshot') {\\n // synchronize local state with snapshot from main\\n const p = e.payload || {};\\n run.message = p.message ?? run.message;\\n if (typeof p.progress === 'number') run.progress = p.progress;\\n if (p.costUSD != null) run.costUSD = p.costUSD;\\n if (p.promptTokens != null) run.promptTokens = p.promptTokens;\\n if (p.completionTokens != null) run.completionTokens = p.completionTokens;\\n if (p.provider) run.provider = p.provider;\\n if (p.model) run.model = p.model;\\n if (p.state) run.state = p.state;\\n if (p.startedAt) run.startedAt = p.startedAt;\\n } else if (e.type === 'run/error') {\\n run.state = 'error';\\n run.message = e.payload?.message || e.payload?.error || 'Error';\\n } else if (e.type === 'run/cancelled') {\\n run.state = 'cancelled';\\n run.message = e.payload?.reason || 'Cancelled';\\n } else if (e.type === 'run/completed' || e.type === 'run/complete') {\\n run.state = 'completed';\\n run.message = e.payload?.message || e.payload?.summary || 'Completed';\\n // Fire notifications for completion\\n this.fireCompletionNotifications(run);\\n // One last pass to detect any feature completions not captured earlier\\n this.checkAndNotifyFeatureCompletions(run);\\n }\\n this.notify();\\n if (run.state !== 'running') {\\n try { run.events.close(); } catch {}\\n }\\n };\\n run.events.addEventListener('*', onAny);\\n }\\n\\n private async coerceAgentTypeForTask(agentType: AgentType, projectId: string, taskId: string): Promise {\\n try {\\n const task = await window.tasksService.getTask(projectId, taskId);\\n if (!task) return agentType;\\n const features = Array.isArray(task?.features) ? ',\\n startedAt: new Date().toISOString(),\\n updatedAt: new Date().toISOString(),\\n lastMessageAt: undefined,\\n provider: llmConfig?.provider,\\n model: llmConfig?.model,\\n messagesLog: {},\\n events,\\n cancel: (reason?: string) => handle.cancel(reason),\\n __notifiedFeatures: new Set(),\\n } as RunRecord;\\n\\n this.wireRunEvents(run);\\n\\n this.runs.set(run.runId, run);\\n this.notify();\\n return this.publicFromRecord(run);\\n }\\n\\n async startFeatureAgent(agentType: AgentType, projectId: string, taskId: string, featureId: string, llmConfig: LLMConfig, githubCredentials : GithubCredentials, webSearchApiKeys? : WebSearchApiKeys): Promise {\\n console.log('[agentsService] startFeatureAgent', { agentType, projectId, taskId, featureId, llmConfig: redactConfig(llmConfig) });\\n const { handle, events } = await startFeatureRun({ agentType, projectId, taskId, featureId, llmConfig, githubCredentials, webSearchApiKeys, options: { } });\\n const run: RunRecord = {\\n runId: handle.id,\\n agentType,\\n projectId,\\n taskId,\\n featureId,\\n state: 'running',\\n message: 'Starting agent... ',\\n startedAt: new Date().toISOString(),\\n updatedAt: new Date().toISOString(),\\n lastMessageAt: undefined,\\n provider: llmConfig?.provider,\\n model: llmConfig?.model,\\n messagesLog: {},\\n events,\\n cancel: (reason?: string) => handle.cancel(reason),\\n __notifiedFeatures: new Set(),\\n } as RunRecord;\\n\\n this.wireRunEvents(run);\\n\\n this.runs.set(run.runId, run);\\n this.notify();\\n return this.publicFromRecord(run);\\n }\\n}\\n\\nexport const agentsService = new AgentsServiceImpl();\\n\"}"}]
